Body:
What are the allophones of /ɹ/ in General Western English?

By General Western English, I mean the dialect of English that is spoken by people raised in Seattle, WA; Portland, OR; and other places west of the Cascade Mountains in the USA.

I have heard someone say that there are twelve, but I have been unable to confirm the number on the internet, and have not been able to find a specific list of them either.
Title: What are the allophones of /ɹ/ in General Western English?

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.

OwnerUser.AboutMe: I'm a conlanger who needs reliable information about real languages. By profession, I'm a speech/language therapist, so some of my questions may be work-related as well.
